New Records: Finn Allen scored 137 runs from 62 balls, setting a new individual record for New Zealand in this match.
New Zealand scored a total of 224-7, while Pakistan scored 179-7.
Key Match Events: Finn Allen and Tim Seifert formed a 125-run partnership after Devon Conway's early dismissal.
Finn Allen hit a six in the 18th over to take New Zealand past the 200-run mark.
Tim Southee took two wickets in his four-over spell.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan won the toss and decided to field first, but New Zealand's strong batting performance put pressure on them.
Shaheen Afridi, the Pakistan captain, seemed unsure after Finn Allen's quick scoring.
Post-Match Reflections: Finn Allen was named Player of the Match for his outstanding performance.
New Zealand secured an unassailable lead in the series with this win, marking a significant milestone.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at University Oval in Dunedin.
Mohammad Wasim conceded 35 runs in four overs, the cheapest spell by a Pakistan bowler.
